description:
Conversion and change of use of the property from its existing uses at basement and ground floors as 'live work' accommodation (Sui Generis use) and upper floors as residential accommodation (C3 use) to a single family dwelling house (C3 use). [Listed Building Consent application ref: P112221 also submitted]
This application may affect the character and appearance of a conservation area and the setting of a listed building.  Town and Country Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended); Sections 67 and 73.
Please note this letter supersedes that dated 13 October, 2011 and contains additional information that the proposal will affect a conservation area and the setting of a listed building.
decision_conditions: REASON: The change of use of the basement and ground floor levels of the building would result in the loss of occupied business accommodation and a 'live-work' unit in the Central Activities Zone that is considered suitable for occupation by small enterprises and would be contrary to policies E4 (Loss of business use), E13 (Protection of Premises for Small Firms and Opportunities for Business Start Ups) and H3 (New housing and changes of use to residential) of the Islington Unitary Development Plan 2002, policies CS7 (Bunhill and Clerkenwell) and CS13 (Employment spaces) of the Islington Core Strategy 2011 and policies 2.10 (Central Activities Zone – strategic priorities), 2.11 (Central Activities Zone – strategic functions), 2.12 (Central Activities Zone – predominantly local activities), 2.13 (Opportunity areas and intensification areas), 4.1 (Developing London’s economy) and 4.2 (Offices) of the London Plan 2011.
